newsitem.title: CAMBODIA: Cambodian royalists seek to replace prince.
newsitem.headline: Cambodian royalists seek to replace prince.

text.p: A senior member of Cambodia's ousted First Prime Minister Prince Norodom Ranariddh's party said on Friday it was time to seek a replacement for Ranariddh because of political realities.

"How can we organise a resistance? The situation is very different than previous years," Loy Sim Chheang, secretary general of Ranariddh's FUNCINPEC party and first vice president of the parliament, told reporters. "We need to be flexible."

Loy Sim Chheang said FUNCINPEC still existed and was preparing to ask Ranariddh to name a replacement as party president. The government was also taking steps to name a new first prime minister, he said.
He said royalists could no longer count on the type of regional support that enabled them to oppose Hun Sen's Hanoi-backed government in the 1980s.
Second Prime Minister Hun Sen's forces wrested power away from Ranariddh during fighting in Phnom Penh last weekend.
Ranariddh has accused Hun Sen of staging a coup, but Hun Sen has denied the charge and said he would keep Cambodia's coalition government intact, although without Ranariddh.
